conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: good morning i'm doctor athol a cardiologist how can i assist you today

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: morning doctor i'm here because i had a heart attack a few weeks ago i was treated in the emergency room and they told me to come see a cardiologist

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i'm sorry to hear that can you tell me more about the symptoms you experienced at that time

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i had a heavy feeling in my chest sweating and some shortness of breath the pain was severe and it also went into my left arm

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i see and how have you been feeling since the incident

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: i've been feeling a bit tired and i still have some chest discomfort on exertion

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: have you had any change in your appetite or weight any fever cough or swelling in your legs

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: alright let's move on to some tests we'll need an egg an echocardiogram a stress test to evaluate your heart function and measure the extent of the damage

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: your heart rate and blood pressure are slightly elevated which is not unexpected given your recent myocardial infarction the rest of the examination is unremarkable from your symptoms and examination it seems you've had a significant heart attack and there may be some ongoing angina it's important to manage this well to prevent further events

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: start medication including aiza abeta blocker statin and possibly a nitrate for the chest pain it's also important to make lifestyle changes quit smoking if you do maintain a healthy diet and start a regular exercise routine
